summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney dated July 18, 2008, providing an update on the federal civil suits against Jeffrey Epstein. It states that a victim notification letter has been filed in court and that about 10 letters have been sent out, with the FBI's victim coordinator updating addresses for the remainder to be sent the following Monday.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, providing an update on victim notification efforts in the federal civil suits against Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the federal civil suits mentioned in the email, against whom victim notification letters are being sent.

connections.description: The Assistant U.S. Attorney is involved in prosecuting or managing civil suits against Jeffrey Epstein, as indicated by the update on victim notifications.

events.title: Victim Notification Letter Filed
events.description: A victim notification letter was filed in court in connection with one of the federal civil suits against Jeffrey Epstein.

locations.context: The address of the Assistant U.S. Attorney's office, as provided in the email signature.

keyFacts: A victim notification letter related to federal civil suits against Jeffrey Epstein was filed in court on or before July 18, 2008.
Approximately 10 victim notification letters had been sent out by July 18, 2008, with more to be sent after address updates.
The FBI's victim coordinator was involved in updating victim addresses for the notification process.
The correspondence originates from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in West Palm Beach, Florida, indicating active federal legal proceedings in that district.
